title: Congress Opens Boeing 737 MAX Hearing Looking to Toughen Oversight
text:
WASHINGTON—U.S. lawmakers kicked off two consecutive days of hearings Tuesday on what went wrong with Boeing Co.’s 737 MAX jet, with many already looking to tighten federal oversight of how jetliners are certified.

Boeing CEO Dennis Muilenburg for the first time is facing congressional interrogation about a faulty flight-control system that led to dual crashes of the MAX, the company’s best-selling plane, taking a total 346 lives. Much of the discussion is likely to touch on ways to ensure the safety of updates to other aircraft...
